newsitem.title: EGYPT: Qatar says will probably buy U.S. weapons.
newsitem.headline: Qatar says will probably buy U.S. weapons.

text.p: Qatar will probably start to buy arms from the United States, Foreign Minister Sheikh Hamad bin Jassim al-Thani said in an interview published on Tuesday.

"Traditionally Qatar bought its weapons from Europe -- France and the United Kingdom -- but the possibility of buying arms in the future from the United States has not been ruled out. It is probable in the future," the minister said.
The interview appeared in the London-based Arabic newspaper al-Hayat under an agreement with the Mideast Mirror, which conducted the interview.
The minister gave the interview during a visit to Washington by the Emir of the small Gulf state, Sheikh Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani.
He said one of the subjects the emir would discuss was strengthening military cooperation between the two countries.
Qatar and the United States signed a defence agreement in 1992, after the Gulf War, but Qatar has continued to buy European weapons in preference to American.
Last year Qatar agreed to spend $825 million on a package of armoured personnel carriers, patrol boats, training aircraft and missiles from British arms manufacturers.
